DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test effectiveness behavioral weight loss exercise intervention deliver via internet different cancer center New England . The investigator hypothesize participant lose 7 % body weight . The research do many woman treat breast cancer overweight treatment breast cancer often accompany weight gain . Individuals overweight may likely breast cancer come back . Also woman exercise least three hour week seem less chance cancer come back . The investigator hope identify effective weight loss exercise intervention breast cancer survivor easily access many people . This study design determine feasibility conduct distantly delivered-weight loss exercise intervention patient treat breast cancer three cancer center , evaluate efficacy Internet-based behavioral weight loss exercise intervention deliver overweight/obese breast cancer survivor three New England location . Participants recruit three New England Cancer Centers - Vermont Cancer Center , Norris Cotton Cancer Center Dartmouth University University Massachusetts Cancer Center . Participants center undergo baseline assessment include diet assessment , body measurement ( height , weight , etc ) , physical activity assessment ask complete series questionnaire . Patients meet minimum requirement enrol study . They participate weekly on-line `` chat '' behavioral diet modification lead qualified facilitator . Participants also engage increase amount aerobic activity ( typically walk ) throughout course intervention . The intervention last 6 month . At end 6 month , participant assessment collect baseline . Following collection assessment , participant complete study .
DOC.brief_title: An Internet-based Weight Loss Exercise Intervention Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.criteria: breast cancer diagnosis Completion surgery , chemotherapy +/ radiation stage I , II , III breast cancer 212 month prior study initiation BMI 27 50 patient selfreport ability walk 10 minute without interruption pain access computer internet metastatic disease prior receipt chemotherapy malignancy pregnancy time study entry limit food choice due celiac sprue inflammatory bowel disease illiteracy nonEnglish speaking
